awd_titl_txt: Forty-Second Annual Gaseous Electronics Conference:         Palo Alto, California; October 1989 (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: It is proposed to hold the 42nd annual Gaseous Electronics                 Conference in Palo Alto, California  October 17-20, 1989.  The                  Conference will provide a forum for exchange of information on                  the basic physics and chemistry of ionized gases and of                         macroscopic discharge phenomena, dealing with basic collisional,                radiative and plasma processes.  Emphasis is given to the                       underlying processes that occur in electric discharges, arcs, gas               lasers, and weakly ionized plasma.  A substantial part of the                   program will be devoted to electron collisional processes,                      especially electron impact excitation and ionization of atoms and               molecules in selected ground and excited states.  A second area                 is the characterization of the fundamental processes important in               plasma processing reactors for semiconductor manufacturing.                     Sessions are planned on (1) plasma chemistry and processing, (2)                heavy particle and excited state collisions, (3) the use of                     plasmas for measuring fundamental data, (4) the argon/Xenon                     laser, and (5) electron impact ionization.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
